questions.question_text: A web developer wants to create a new web part within the company website that aggregates sales from individual team sites. A cybersecurity analyst wants to ensure security measurements are implemented during this process. Which of the following remediation actions should the analyst take to implement a vulnerability management process?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Vulnerability scan

A vulnerability scan involves using automated tools to scan the web part and associated systems for known vulnerabilities. This process helps identify potential security weaknesses, misconfigurations, or outdated software versions that could be exploited by attackers. By conducting regular vulnerability scans, the analyst can stay informed about any vulnerabilities and take appropriate actions to mitigate or remediate them.

I will try B
A vulnerability scan can be a part of a vulnerability management process, but it is not a remediation action in itself. The purpose of a vulnerability scan is to identify vulnerabilities that need to be addressed, while remediation actions are the steps taken to fix those vulnerabilities.
It is ok

comments.content: I don't get how change management process could be the part of vulnerability management process. I think the correct answer is B.

questions.question_text:
A company just chose a global software company based in Europe to implement a new supply chain management solution. Which of the following would be the
MAIN concern of the company?

discussion.content: I think its D, if the concern were national laws why would you stress that you are a company from Europe? the company probably does business with different countries...so it should be concerned about international law.
I think its D

comments.content: I will probably choose C (loss of intellectual property) for this.
Europe has some of the tightest Labour laws. It cant be D.
Also different laws that governs security policies
Its a security concern for a security exam

discussion.content: How is this A??

comments.content: I am now but nobody updates after the test i will update the main page if cs0-001 is on cs0-002

discussion.content: Has anyone used these questions while preparing for CySA+ CS0-002?
I think the answer is D because the analyst is looking for a permanent solution. The question asked for a way to prevent this from happening in the future.

comments.content:
Answer C is correct.

Why? Firstly, the question has already pointed out that "all the remote laptops have become infected with a known virus that was introduced by a known application weakness". Meaning to say, the known application was already installed on each of the remote laptop. Secondly, it was also mentioned that the remote workforce group are experiencing "degradation in services" because of the above ^. Hence the only way you are going to ensure the workforce group do not experience this issue is by fixing the known weakness/vulnerability first. Through receiving updates, patches, bug fixes, or definition.

Answer A, B, D are not going resolve the root cause therefore they are wrong because they are not going to fix the root problem which is the know application weakness.

discussion.content: Was infected with "know virus" this mean updated antivirus can detect and delete the virus, so, the answer is correct.
I'm thinking B. If you force them to go through the internal network (with VPN) you can exercise some control over the traffic to and from these workstations.

comments.content:
Answer C is correct. 

Why? Firstly, the question has already pointed out that "all the remote laptops have become infected with a known virus that was introduced by a known application weakness". Meaning to say, the known application was already installed on each of the remote laptop. Secondly, it was also mentioned that the remote workforce group are experiencing "degradation in services" because of the above ^. Hence the only way you are going to ensure the workforce group do not experience this issue is by fixing the known weakness/vulnerability first. Through receiving updates, patches, bug fixes, or definition. 

Answer A, B, D are not going resolve the root cause therefore they are wrong because they are not going to fix the root problem which is the know application weakness.

choices.D: Develop and configure a whitelist on each laptop for authored, business-related websites only.
choices.B: Configure the devices to access the Internet through the corporate network only.
choices.A: Communicate to the remote workers that company laptops are for work purposes only.
choices.C: Ensure devices receive software updates and definitions upon connecting to the internal network.

questions.question_text:
The service desk has received several calls from the remote workforce group stating they have experienced degradation in services The security analyst discovers all the remote laptops have become infected with a known virus that was introduced by a known application weakness. Which of the following is the
BEST course of action to ensure the remote workers do not experience this issue in the future?

A software assurance lab is performing a dynamic assessment on an application by automatically generating and inputting different, random data sets to attempt to cause an error/failure condition. Which of the following software assessment capabilities is the lab performing AND during which phase of the SDLC should this occur? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: This question was in the exam :)

I don't think it could be static code analysis, that is when multiple programmers are looking over the code syntax and making sure everything it compliant, and they explicitly do not run/execute the code or program itself.

If you only go by the exam objectives laid out in section 4.4 from comptia, then the answer should be fuzzing/security regression testing. going by the question answer choices though, it should be fuzzing/prototyping phase. prototyping phase is a legit part of the SDLC, but again comptia doesn't acknowledge it in the exam objectives so idk about this question. I would say A and D.
Random data for Fuzzing
Fuzzing & Prototyping get my vote.
this question was in exam
Fuzzing is one of the most commoon dynamic analysis techniques, meaning "static analysis" as an answer is incorrect.

comments.content:
fuzzing is a verification/testing tool, which is performed in the last stage before release/deployment.
reference: https://www.synopsys.com/glossary/what-is-sdlc.html

discussion.content: the correct answers are fuzzing and prototyping phase. if you check beyondsecurity.com you realize fuzzing is performed during the development process. Development process is tantamount to the prototyping phase.
Agree with holst. Can’t be static code analysis. The closest option seems to be fuzzing and prototyping.
The answer is A to avoid the incidence not reoccurring.

This should be A.

Not B, NDAs is signed agreement.
Not C, employee can still tell others verbally.
Not D, why would the law enforcement bother talk to the employees? Its not their job to educate people or how to handle what they know about the company, it should be the management/HR' job.

I would suggest D. Mainly because this incident is being investigated by law enforcement already. A is really for before, b is too late as well. C was my first pick but I don't think is the right one. Similar Q on cs0-002.
I would say option D.
Would go with C on this
think B is better, Option A makes more sense before a data breach was detected

comments.content: NDAs are signed agreements, not verbal

questions.question_text: Law enforcement has contacted a corporation's legal counsel because correlated data from a breach shows the organization as the common denominator from all indicators of compromise. An employee overhears the conversation between legal counsel and law enforcement, and then posts a comment about it on social media. The media then starts contacting other employees about the breach. Which of the following steps should be taken to prevent further disclosure of information about the breach?

choices.C: Temporarily disable employee access to social media
choices.B: Request all employees verbally commit to an NDA about the breach.
choices.A: Perform security awareness training about incident communication.
choices.D: Have law enforcement meet with employees.
